alert.note: Alert for Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 8:09PM EDT until April 08 at 5:01AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... East Branch Brandywine Creek Below Downingtown affecting Chester County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Brandywine Creek Below Downingtown. * WHEN...From this evening to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Open adjacent land next to the creek floods. At 8.0 feet, Dowlin Forge Road begins to flood. At 9.0 feet, High water on the Brandywine sends backwater up Beaver Creek. Beaver Creek floods inundating parks and the Downingtown Little League fields. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 6.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening and crest at 8.9 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.2 feet on 10/23/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (8 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date East Branch Bran Downingtown 7.0 6.8 Thu 7 pm 4.3 MSG 8.9 9pm 4/07 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 515 AM EDT.
